alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Madison; Oconee; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 7:07PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Oconee, southeastern Clarke, northwestern Oglethorpe and southeastern Madison Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 707 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Lexington, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, pea sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and increased chance of a brief tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...While winds should result in minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects, this storm has also exhibited localized rotation. A brief tornado could quickly form. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Comer, Crawford, Arnoldsville, Carlton, Athens-Clarke County, Smithonia, Watson Mill Bridge State Park, Hutchings, Barnett Shoals and Paoli. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern Georgia.
